TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RouteCollection extends System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<class System.Web.Routing.RouteBase>
Public Class RouteCollection Inherits Collection(Of RouteBase)

summary.span: 提供進行 ASP.NET 路由之路由的集合。

span.span: Provides a collection of routes for ASP.NET routing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 類別提供方法，讓您能夠管理衍生自物件的集合類別。The class provides methods that enable you to manage a collection of objects that derive from the class. 一般而言，您將使用`static`屬性類別來擷取物件。Typically, you will use the `static` property of the class to retrieve a object. 屬性儲存 ASP.NET 應用程式的所有路由。The property stores all the routes for an ASP.NET application. ASP.NET 路由中的路由會逐一屬性來尋找相符的 URL 的路由。ASP.NET routing iterates through the routes in the property to find the route that matches a URL. 若要建構 URL，請呼叫方法並傳入值的集合。To construct a URL, you call the method and pass in a collection of values. 方法會尋找符合您傳入，並傳回值參數的第一個路由物件，其中包含相符的路由的相關資訊。The method finds the first route with parameters that match the values that you passed in, and returns a object that contains information about the matching route. 擷取透過 URL屬性物件。You retrieve the URL through the property of the object. 您可以新增使用的名稱，或沒有名稱的路由。You can add a route either with a name or without a name. 其中包括名稱可讓您區分類似路由建構 Url 時。Including a name enables you to distinguish between similar routes when URLs are constructed. 如果您未指定名稱，ASP.NET 路由會使用第一個相符的路由集合中建構 URL。If you do not specify a name, ASP.NET routing uses the first matching route in the collection to construct a URL. 當您將加入未命名的通往物件，您無法加入已存在於集合中的路由。When you add an unnamed route to the object, you cannot add a route that already is in the collection. 當您將具名的路由時，您無法使用已識別的路由集合中的名稱。When you add a named route, you cannot use a name that already identifies a route in the collection. 您使用方法和方法，確定您互動的集合，而不會防止其他處理序衝突。You use the method and the method to make sure that you interact with the collection without conflicts from other processes. 如需如何將路由新增至路由集合的詳細資訊，請參閱[ASP.NET 路由](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/892441af-8f1d-483e-ab5f-b82c23576f5a)。For more information about how to add a route to a route collection, see [ASP.NET Routing](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/892441af-8f1d-483e-ab5f-b82c23576f5a).

summary.span: 在 物件結尾處，加入一個路由並且為該路由指定名稱。

span.span: Adds a route to the end of the object and assigns the specified name to the route.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法可讓您定義的路由名稱，當您將它加入此路由集合。The method enables you to define a name for a route when you add it to the route collection. 藉由定義路由的名稱，您可以指定您用於路由建構 URL 時所要使用的特定路由。By defining a name for the route, you can specify a particular route to use when you use routing to construct a URL. 當一個以上的路由符合您傳遞給的值時指定的特定路由是重要方法。Specifying a particular route is important when more than one route matches the values that you pass to the method. 如果您未指定具名的路由，則 ASP.NET 路由會使用符合值的集合中的第一個路由。If you do not specify a named route, ASP.NET routing will use the first route in the collection that matches the values. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[How to： 建構 Url 的路由從](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/1ffd4085-71f6-4822-be8f-f682ca638650)。For more information, see [How to: Construct URLs from Routes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/1ffd4085-71f6-4822-be8f-f682ca638650). 名稱可以用一次只能在物件。A name can be used only one time in the object. 如果您沒有指定的路由名稱，您可以藉由呼叫來新增路由方法。If you do not have to specify a name for the route, you can add the route by calling the method. 使用方法和方法，確定您互動的集合，而不會防止其他處理序衝突。Use the method and the method to make sure that you interact with the collection without conflicts from other processes. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何將加入的路由物件，並將名稱指派給路由。The following example shows how to add a route to a object and assign a name to the route. [!code-csharp[System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.MapPageRoute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.web.routing.routecollection.mappageroute/cs/global.asax#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.MapPageRoute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.web.routing.routecollection.mappageroute/vb/global.asax#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法和方法，確定您互動的集合，而不會防止其他處理序衝突。Use the method and the method to make sure that you interact with the collection without conflicts from other processes.

summary.span: 提供物件，以便您從集合中擷取物件時用於管理執行緒安全性。

span.span: Provides an object for managing thread safety when you retrieve an object from the collection.

returns.span: 管理執行緒安全性的物件。

span.span: An object that manages thread safety.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 物件可用於應用程式中的多個處理序。The object is available to multiple processes in the application. 如果您有應用程式執行時，擷取一個路由，因此，使用方法，以確保執行緒安全。Therefore, if you have to retrieve a route when the application is running, use the method in order to guarantee thread safety. 藉由取得讀取的鎖定的路由集合，您要確定您嘗試擷取它時，不會修改集合項目。By obtaining a read lock on the route collection, you make sure that the collection will not be modified while you are trying to retrieve it. 方法停止執行緒的可以取得鎖定為止。The method stops the thread from continuing until the lock can be acquired. 如果寫入鎖定的位置中，執行緒會等候直到完成更新後，並且寫入鎖定時。If a write lock is in place, the thread waits until the update is completed and the write lock is released. 在釋放的路由集合讀取的鎖定時處置這個方法所傳回的物件。The read lock on the route collection is released when the object that is returned by this method is disposed. 如果您未使用，您可能會發生錯誤，當您閱讀集合。If you do not use , you might get an error while you are reading through the collection. 例如，假設您在迴圈中的物件集合讀取，而不需呼叫。For example, suppose you loop through the objects in the collection to read them, without calling . 雖然您會這樣做，可能會呼叫另一個執行緒從另一個要求並將路由加入至集合。While you are doing that, another thread from another request might call and add a route to the collection. 第一個執行緒，然後將失敗並產生錯誤。The first thread will then fail with an error. 有兩種案例中您不需要呼叫:There are two scenarios in which you do not have to call : - 公用方法類別如和呼叫內部。Public methods of the class such as and call internally. 因此，您沒有明確呼叫當您呼叫的公用方法類別，以從集合中擷取資料。Therefore, you do not have to explicitly call when you call a public method of the class to retrieve data from the collection. - 當應用程式正在啟動，且不尚未在處理要求，例如在`Application_Start`事件處理常式，只有一個執行緒正在執行。When the application is starting and is not yet processing requests, such as in the `Application_Start` event handler, only one thread is running. 因為有其他執行緒可能會更新集合，在您讀取時，您不需要呼叫。Because there are no other threads that might update the collection while you are reading it, you do not have to call . ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用方法時執行的應用程式時，擷取一個路由。The following example shows how to use the method when you retrieve a route while the application is running. `Using`陳述式可確保，無論您在讀取時從集合 （不論程式碼會正常完成，或擲回例外狀況） 的執行階段會發生什麼情況會安全地釋放鎖定的結尾`Using`程式碼區塊。The `Using` statement ensures that no matter what happens at run time when you read from the collection (whether the code completes normally or an exception is thrown) the lock will be safely released at the end of the `Using` code block.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 定義 ASP.NET 應用程式中的路由的建議的方法是新增至路由屬性中的事件處理常式`Application_Start`Global.asax 檔案中的事件。The recommended approach for defining routes in an ASP.NET application is to add the routes to the property in an event handler for the `Application_Start` event in the Global.asax file. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 您必須新增一個路由，應用程式執行時，如果您使用方法，以確保執行緒安全。If you have to add a route when the application is running, you use the method to guarantee thread safety. 釋放此路由集合寫入鎖定時處置這個方法所傳回的物件。The write lock on the route collection is released when the object that is returned by this method is disposed. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用方法時執行的應用程式時，新增的路由。The following example shows how to use the method when you add a route while the application is running.

summary.span: 定義不需檢查是否符合路由的 URL 模式。

span.span: Defines a URL pattern that should not be checked for matches against routes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會建立對應到路由路由處理常式。This method creates a route that is mapped to the route handler. 呼叫這個方法之後，符合指定的 URL 模式的要求將不會處理與路由要求。After you call this method, requests that match the specified URL pattern will not be processed as route requests. ASP.NET 路由自動時，會忽略要求 URL 與相符實體的檔案，例如影像檔。ASP.NET routing automatically ignores requests when the URL matches a physical file, such as an image file. 在某些情況下您也可以路由傳送至任何實體的檔案時忽略要求。In some cases you might also want routing to ignore requests when there is no physical file. 例如，ASP.NET 會自動將.axd 檔案的要求應該不被視為路由要求即使沒有對應至.axd 副檔名的實體檔案。For example, the requests that ASP.NET automatically makes for .axd files should not be treated as route requests even though there is no physical file that corresponds to the .axd file-name extension.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Ignore (string url);
.method public hidebysig instance void Ignore(string url) cil managed
Public Sub Ignore (url As String)
public: void Ignore(System::String ^ url);

param.name: url
param.span: 要忽略的 URL 模式。

span.span: The URL pattern to be ignored.

summary.span: 定義不需檢查是否符合路由的 URL 模式。

span.span: Defines a URL pattern that should not be checked for matches against routes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會建立對應到路由路由處理常式。This method creates a route that is mapped to the route handler. 呼叫這個方法之後，符合指定的 URL 模式的要求將不會處理與路由要求。After you call this method, requests that match the specified URL pattern will not be processed as route requests. ASP.NET 路由自動時，會忽略要求 URL 與相符實體的檔案，例如影像檔。ASP.NET routing automatically ignores requests when the URL matches a physical file, such as an image file. 在某些情況下您也可以路由傳送至任何實體的檔案時忽略要求。In some cases you might also want routing to ignore requests when there is no physical file. 例如，ASP.NET 會自動將.axd 檔案的要求應該不被視為路由要求即使沒有對應至.axd 副檔名的實體檔案。For example, the requests that ASP.NET automatically makes for .axd files should not be treated as route requests even though there is no physical file that corresponds to the .axd file-name extension. ## Examples MVC 專案的預設範本會使用這個方法從路由，排除.axd 檔案，如下列範例所示：The default template for MVC projects uses this method to exclude .axd files from routing, as shown in the following example: [!code-csharp[MvcDefaultApp#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/mvcdefaultapp/cs/global.asax.cs#2)] [!code-vb[MvcDefaultApp#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/mvcdefaultapp/vb/global.asax.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Ignore (string url, object constraints);
.method public hidebysig instance void Ignore(string url, object constraints) cil managed
Public Sub Ignore (url As String, constraints As Object)
public: void Ignore(System::String ^ url, System::Object ^ constraints);

param.name: url
param.span: 要忽略的 URL 模式。

span.span: The URL pattern to be ignored.

param.name: constraints
param.span: 其他準則，可用來判斷是否忽略與 URL 模式相符的要求。

span.span: Additional criteria that determine whether a request that matches the URL pattern will be ignored.

summary.span: 定義 URL 模式，此模式在要求 URL 符合指定的條件約束時並不需要進行檢查是否與路由相符。

span.span: Defines a URL pattern that should not be checked for matches against routes if a request URL meets the specified constraints.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會建立對應到路由路由處理常式。This method creates a route that is mapped to the route handler. 呼叫這個方法之後，符合指定的 URL 模式的要求將不會處理與路由要求。After you call this method, requests that match the specified URL pattern will not be processed as route requests. ASP.NET 路由自動時，會忽略要求 URL 與相符實體的檔案，例如影像檔。ASP.NET routing automatically ignores requests when the URL matches a physical file, such as an image file. 在某些情況下您也可以路由傳送至任何實體的檔案時忽略要求。In some cases you might also want routing to ignore requests when there is no physical file. 例如，ASP.NET 會自動將.axd 檔案的要求應該不被視為路由要求即使沒有對應至.axd 副檔名的實體檔案。For example, the requests that ASP.NET automatically makes for .axd files should not be treated as route requests even though there is no physical file that corresponds to the .axd file-name extension. ## Examples 下列範例會示範如何使用這個方法來略過所有.aspx 副檔名的 Url。The following example shows how to use this method to ignore all URLs that have an .aspx extension. 您可能想要執行這項操作，如果您註冊自訂 HTTP 處理常式來處理所有 Url 的副檔名為".aspx"的檔案。You might want to do this if you register a custom HTTP handler to handle all URLs for files that have the extension ".aspx". 單一的 URL 模式會比對所有.aspx 的要求，例如需要兩個雜物箱 參數`{*path}.aspx/{*pathinfo}`。A single URL pattern that would match all .aspx requests would require two catchall parameters such as `{*path}.aspx/{*pathinfo}`. （此模式會比.aspx，包括具有查詢字串參數在結束任何 URL）。不過，路由可讓只有一個雜物箱 參數結尾。(This pattern would match any URL that ends in .aspx, including those that have query-string parameters.) However, routing allows only one catchall parameter at the end. 或者，您可以指定具有單一雜物箱] 參數符合所有 Url 的 URL 模式，然後指定 [排除所有項目沒有.aspx 副檔名，如下列範例所示的條件約束：As an alternative, you can specify a URL pattern that has a single catchall parameter that matches all URLs and then specify constraints that exclude everything that does not have the .aspx extension, as shown in the following example: ```vb routes.Ignore("{*allaspx}", new With {.allaspx = ".*\.aspx(/.*)?"}) ``` ```csharp routes.Ignore("{*allaspx}", new {allaspx=@".*\.aspx(/.*)?"}); ``` 上一行的程式碼通常會加入至從呼叫的方法`Application_Start`在 Global.asax 中的範例所示的方法多載。The previous line of code would typically be added to a method that is called from the `Application_Start` method in the Global.asax, as shown in the example for the overload.

span.span: The parameter is .

summary.span: 將指定的路由插入 物件中的指定索引處。

span.span: Inserts the specified route into the object at the specified index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 當您將加入未命名的通往物件，您無法加入已存在於集合中的路由。When you add an unnamed route to the object, you cannot add a route that already is in the collection. 使用方法和方法，確定您互動的集合，而不會防止其他處理序衝突。Use the method and the method to make sure that you interact with the collection without conflicts from other processes.

span.span: is .
is already in the collection.

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether URLs are converted to lower case when virtual paths are normalized.

span.span: to convert URLs to lower case; otherwise .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果在 URL 中包含查詢字串，該 URL 的一部分並不會轉換成小寫。If a query string is included in the URL, that part of the URL is not converted to lower case.

summary.span: 提供一種方式來定義 Web Form 應用程式的路由。

span.span: Provides a way to define routes for Web Forms applications.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法被提供給方便撰寫程式碼。This method is provided for coding convenience. 它相當於呼叫方法並傳遞使用所建立的物件類別。It is equivalent to calling the method and passing a object that is created by using the class. ## Examples 下列範例會示範如何使用這個方法來定義 Web Forms 應用程式的路由。The following example shows how to define routes for a Web Forms application by using this method. 此範例會示範名為的方法`RegisterRoutes`，而呼叫從`Application_Start`Global.asax 檔中。The example shows a method named `RegisterRoutes` that is called from `Application_Start` in the Global.asax file. 此方法會使用的每個多載將路徑新增至應用程式。The method uses each overload of to add a route to the application. 如需如何定義路由 Web Form 應用程式的詳細資訊，請參閱[如何： 定義 Web Form 應用程式的路由](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/200fe812-d0a6-4531-b9b4-cfc4ee83a678)。For more information about how to define routes for Web Forms applications, see [How to: Define Routes for Web Forms Applications](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/200fe812-d0a6-4531-b9b4-cfc4ee83a678). [!code-csharp[System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.MapPageRoute#122](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.web.routing.routecollection.mappageroute/cs/global.asax#122)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.MapPageRoute#122](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.web.routing.routecollection.mappageroute/vb/global.asax#122)]

summary.span: 取得或設定值，指出 ASP.NET 路由是否應該處理符合現有檔案的 URL。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether ASP.NET routing should handle URLs that match an existing file.

value.span: 如果 ASP.NET 路由會處理所有要求 (包括符合現有檔案的要求)，則為 ，否則為 。

span.span: if ASP.NET routing handles all requests, even those that match an existing file; otherwise, .
The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 雖然這個值可以動態變更，使用 ASP.NET 路由整合時，將會忽略服務已啟動後所做的任何變更。Although this value can be changed dynamically, any change made after a service has been activated will be ignored when using ASP.NET routing integration. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[ASP.NET 路由整合](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195235)。For more information, see [ASP.NET Routing Integration](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195235).
